SAP System & Business Process Assessment

Comprehensive audit findings for Al Rawabi Dairy Company (ARDC), Emirates National Foods LLC (ENF), Greenfields for Feeds LLC (GF), and Al Salwa (LIWA) operations across dairy production, poultry farming, feed manufacturing, and distribution.

Assessment Opinion

In our opinion, the current SAP ECC implementation across Emirates Rawabi Group entities does not adequately support the operational requirements of modern dairy and poultry businesses. We identified 845 high-risk findings requiring immediate attention. We recommend a Greenfield S/4HANA implementation with industry-specific solutions including PP-PI for dairy, Livestock Management for poultry, and MSG for meat processing.

Critical Findings Summary

Quality Management Gap

SAP QM module is not active. All quality testing, certifications, and records are maintained on paper. Products released before quality approval.

MRP Not Running

Material Requirements Planning is not executed. Planning is budget-based rather than demand-driven, leading to overproduction and inventory issues.

Missing Industry Solutions

No SAP Livestock Management or MSG modules. Flock tracking, biological asset accounting, and meat processing handled manually via Excel.

Key Recommendations

Priority Recommendation Affected Entities Impact
P1 Implement S/4HANA with PP-PI - Process Industries module for dairy operations with recipe management and yield tracking ARDC Quality, Production, Costing
P1 Deploy SAP Livestock Management - For flock tracking, biological asset accounting, FCR monitoring ENF, LIWA Farm Operations, Finance
P1 Implement SAP MSG - Meat & Fish Management for carcass splitting and catch-weight processing ENF Processing, Costing
P1 Activate SAP QM - Full quality management with inspection lots, certificates, and traceability All Compliance, Quality
P2 Implement SAP IBP - Integrated Business Planning for demand-driven supply planning All Planning, Inventory
